commit_message:
Add support to set concurrency of cinder-backup

This patch introduces two new parameters, backup_workers and
backup_max_operations, so that operators can set concurrency of
cinder-backup process via puppet-cinder.

Change-Id: I6df2a6f62b4339e65cacdcb328c374f7fca8e9fb

commit_message:
sahara: tag ocata as EOL

It has been announced on the list, and it follows the path traced
by other projects (including puppet):
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-October/017709.html

Also, break down the existing setting of the ocata-em branch
for consistency, and clean up a few comments which were only
needed to retrigger some tags.

Change-Id: I1b9bb9436d1dfe21bca7e2730621248400aec246

commit_message:
Add IPv6 rule for content provider registry

Some of VMs has IPv6 address and need to have IPv6 rule that
allow consumers jobs to connect to provider registry.
Run registry on ::1 localhost as well.

> Thanks Andrew! looks good to me.

Me too \o/'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-10-19 09:24:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/victoria as commit 45a4110d20a574d0c43431a4b87497920c9cbe06'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2020-10-19 09:39:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Thanks!  (A bit late here, as I was away last week.)

Not the problem of this patch, but perhaps we should document what libvirt means by 'require' in the code, as it isn't entirely clear to the casual code reader :-)

To copy/paste what I wrote in the bug:

[quote]
As you might've discovered, policy='require' means, in libvirt parlance, "guest creation will fail unless a given CPU feature is supported by the host CPU _or_ the hypervisor is able to emulate it."

For example, the 'x2apic' is emulated by QEMU even if the host does not support it:

    <feature policy='require' name='x2apic'/>
[/quote]'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2020-10-19 13:51:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2020-10-19 13:51:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

[{'created': '2020-10-12 14:01:52.000000000', 'message': "Handle disabled CPU features to fix live migration failures

When performing a live migration between hypervisors running
libvirt, where one or more CPU features are disabled, nova does
not take account of these. This results in migration failures
as none of the available hypervisor targets appear compatible.

This patch ensures that the libvirt 'disable' poicy is taken
account of, at least in a basic sense, by explicitly ignoring
items flagged in this way when enumerating CPU features.

Closes-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1898715
Change-Id: Iaf14ca97cfac99dd280d1114123f2d4bb6292b63
"}, {'created': '2020-10-16 10:26:11.000000000', 'message': "Handle disabled CPU features to fix live migration failures

When performing a live migration between hypervisors running
libvirt, where one or more CPU features are disabled, nova does
not take account of these. This results in migration failures
as none of the available hypervisor targets appear compatible.

This patch ensures that the libvirt 'disable' poicy is taken
account of, at least in a basic sense, by explicitly ignoring
items flagged in this way when enumerating CPU features.

Closes-Bug: #1898715
Change-Id: Iaf14ca97cfac99dd280d1114123f2d4bb6292b63
"}]
commit_message:
Handle disabled CPU features to fix live migration failures

When performing a live migration between hypervisors running
libvirt, where one or more CPU features are disabled, nova does
not take account of these. This results in migration failures
as none of the available hypervisor targets appear compatible.

This patch ensures that the libvirt 'disable' poicy is taken
account of, at least in a basic sense, by explicitly ignoring
items flagged in this way when enumerating CPU features.

Closes-Bug: #1898715
Change-Id: Iaf14ca97cfac99dd280d1114123f2d4bb6292b63

commit_message:
Add support for image_cache options

This patch introduces a new class named nova::compute::image_cache,
to support parameters in image_cache sections, which were recently
added into nova[1].

[1] 828e8047e5c8651ea757bda7922670889d5e8818

Cleanup redundant default

This change removes redundant default value for heat::keystone::auth,
so that more clear error message when password is not set.

Change-Id: If585a3b6175d9aa2506786d2d158a8261403bd51

commit_message:
Add agent/explicitly_egress_direct support

This configuration parameter for the ML2/OVS agent was added in
I14fefe289a19b718b247bf0740ca9bc47f8903f4 and backported up to
stable/queens, preventing flooding on integration bridge in some cases.

It needs to be enabled on specific node types, so add option to
configure it.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/756591
Related-Bug: #1732067
Change-Id: Iff50d2d086c687ef9ec1ba878e24c06dfc8a7d99
(cherry picked from commit d0bc82d8427c43dac07a8118d2fe35ba5a9d9dce)

[{'created': '2020-10-12 22:47:09.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent archiving of pci_devices records because of 'instance_uuid'

Currently in the archive_deleted_rows code, we will attempt to clean up
"residue" of deleted instance records by assuming any table with a
'instance_uuid' column represents data tied to an instance's lifecycle
and delete such records.

This behavior poses a problem in the case where an instance has a PCI
device allocated and someone deletes the instance. There is a small
time window during which the instance record is deleted but the PCI
device has not yet been freed from a database record perspective as
PCI devices are freed during the _complete_deletion method in the
compute manager as part of the resource tracker update call.

Records in the pci_devices table are anyway not related to the
lifecycle of instances so they should not be considered residule to
clean up if an instance is deleted. This adds a condition to avoid
archiving pci_devices on the basis of an instance association.

Closes-Bug: #1899541

Change-Id: Ie62d3566230aa3e2786d129adbb2e3570b06e4c6
'}, {'created': '2020-10-12 22:53:52.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent archiving of pci_devices records because of 'instance_uuid'

Currently in the archive_deleted_rows code, we will attempt to clean up

and delete such records.

during which the instance record has been deleted but the PCI device
has not yet been freed from a database record perspective as PCI
devices are freed during the _complete_deletion method in the compute
manager as part of the resource tracker update call.

Records in the pci_devices table are anyway not related to the
lifecycle of instances so they should not be considered residue to
clean up if an instance is deleted. This adds a condition to avoid
archiving pci_devices on the basis of an instance association.

Closes-Bug: #1899541

Change-Id: Ie62d3566230aa3e2786d129adbb2e3570b06e4c6
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent archiving of pci_devices records because of 'instance_uuid'

Currently in the archive_deleted_rows code, we will attempt to clean up
"residue" of deleted instance records by assuming any table with a
'instance_uuid' column represents data tied to an instance's lifecycle
and delete such records.

This behavior poses a problem in the case where an instance has a PCI
device allocated and someone deletes the instance. The 'instance_uuid'
column in the pci_devices table is used to track the allocation
association of a PCI with an instance. There is a small time window
during which the instance record has been deleted but the PCI device
has not yet been freed from a database record perspective as PCI
devices are freed during the _complete_deletion method in the compute
manager as part of the resource tracker update call.

Records in the pci_devices table are anyway not related to the
lifecycle of instances so they should not be considered residue to
clean up if an instance is deleted. This adds a condition to avoid
archiving pci_devices on the basis of an instance association.

Closes-Bug: #1899541

Change-Id: Ie62d3566230aa3e2786d129adbb2e3570b06e4c6

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-14 21:06:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix overcloud provisioning with newer Bifrost

Recent changes in Bifrost require the following fixes.

Define instance_info as an empty dict in hostvars. Bifrost checks if
this variable is defined and is not an empty dict before using it, but
somehow its value is null if not provided, which results in the followig
error:

    When setting an instance to present, instance_info is a required variable.

Define ironic_api_url instead of letting Bifrost construct it from
hostvars which fail to be gathered in our environment.

Change-Id: I560e0a23097702ff13a9c8ba587f9ebb0ae11c5b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix overcloud provisioning with newer Bifrost

Recent changes in Bifrost require the following fixes.

Define instance_info as an empty dict in hostvars. Bifrost checks if
this variable is defined and is not an empty dict before using it, but
somehow its value is null if not provided, which results in the followig
error:

    When setting an instance to present, instance_info is a required variable.

Define ironic_api_url instead of letting Bifrost construct it from
hostvars which fail to be gathered in our environment.

Change-Id: I560e0a23097702ff13a9c8ba587f9ebb0ae11c5b

commit_message:
Adding a new tools to search topic on the ML

By default it will research for topics related to the release team but
pattern can be overriden to looking for all kind of topics (c.f the
related doc).

Usages
------

The following example will search for all emails sent openstack-discuss
who match release topics from the creation of the mailing list to the
current day:

```
$ tools/search_emails.py
```

In the following example we search for release countdown emails sent
between May 2020 and today:

```
tools/search_emails.py --topic ".?\[release\] Release countdown.*" --starting-date 2020-5-1
Looking for emails between 2020 May and 2020 September and sent by
Analyzing May 2020: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May
Analyzing June 2020: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-June
Analyzing July 2020: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-July
Analyzing August 2020: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-August
Analyzing September 2020: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-September
15 result(s) have been found

        - [release] Release countdown for week R-1, May 4 - 8 - Sean McGinnis
        http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014577.html
        - [release] Release countdown for week R-0, May 11 - 15 - Sean McGinnis
        http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014780.html
        - [release] Release countdown for week R-20, May 25 - 29 - Sean McGinnis
        http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014999.html
2020-June:
```

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 6469, 'name': 'Carlos Gonçalves', 'display_name': 'Carlos Goncalves', 'email': 'cgoncalves@redhat.com', 'username': 'cgoncalves'}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 11805, 'name': 'Corey Bryant', 'email': 'corey.bryant@canonical.com', 'username': 'coreycb'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 19298, 'name': 'Nicolas Bock', 'email': 'nicolas.bock@canonical.com', 'username': 'nicolasbock'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28522, 'name': 'Hervé Beraud', 'email': 'herveberaud.pro@gmail.com', 'username': 'hberaud'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2020-10-16 17:53:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-10-16 18:32:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We have many backport patches open pending gate fix. I'd suggest holding on dot releases until we merge them.

stable/ussuri: 12 patches
stable/train: 18 patches"}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2020-10-16 18:50:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hey Carlos, Would it be possible to cut these releases now and follow up with new releases for what's in the queue? We have users who are in need of several unreleased fixes. It's worth noting the last stable release for train and ussuri are from June."}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-10-16 19:07:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

OK, fair enough. I thought packagers could easily either rebase directly from branches or cherry-pick backport patches. If that is not the case for some packagers, I won't oppose releasing now. Thank you for proposing them!"}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2020-10-16 20:01:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks Carlos! I really appreciate it. We can cherry-pick individual patches, however the SRU process requires a lot less overhead when picking up stable releases both in both prep and testing.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-10-19 08:24:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-10-19 08:28:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-10-19 08:29:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Good catch, Thierry! Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-10-19 12:56:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-10-19 16:01:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

TODO:
- Add note about setting ``geneve-vni-ranges`` to a value that would encompass all 'gre' and 'vxlan' networks + room to grow.

- Explain the function of the `i-really-mean-it` action parameter (dry run vs. do it) and remove it from the example commands. (The operator should actively type this in otherwise the point of the safeguard kind of evaporates)"}, {'account_id': 30561, 'date': '2020-07-27 18:24:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(33 comments)'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-07-28 06:31:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-09-11 14:34:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-09-11 14:35:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

Suggestions'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-10-16 14:49:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 30561, 'date': '2020-10-16 15:12:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

need confirmation on a previous comment. everything else looks stellar'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-10-16 16:20:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

So the reason for having both the ovn-dedicated-chassis and the ovn-chassis in the example is to continue the thread from other parts of the section where the existence of both neutron-openvswitch and neutron-gateway is mentioned. The user has to compose the steps to match their specific cloud.

The adding of --series focal is because charm support starts at bionic-train, and if someone cuts and pastes this the command either has to say --config source xx or --series or the command they enter will fail.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-10-19 07:06:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-10-19 07:11:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-10-19 07:18:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2020-10-19 14:58:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Just a few grammar fixes needed.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-10-19 15:40:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-10-19 15:40:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2020-10-19 15:54:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Looks good. Landing.'}]

messages:
[{'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-07-23 13:34:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-07-23 13:38:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-07-23 17:03:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-07-24 03:47:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Though if we want to backport it all the way to queens, we can't add that to this patch."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-07-24 03:48:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-07-24 03:49:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-07-24 08:19:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-07-24 12:50:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Supports 'virtio-forwarder' vnic type for port

Supports the 'virtio-forwarder' vnic type for port sync with Neutron.
The 'virtio-forwarder' is an indirect mode for SR-IOV interfaces used to
connect the instances into the Neutron networks. It has been supported
since the Queens release:
I28315fb12f62dc7d52d099c211086b2b81eca39a

Note that 'virtio-forwarder' is already supported by Horizon:
openstack_dashboard/api/neutron.py:
  ('virtio-forwarder', _('Virtio Forwarder'))

Nova:
nova/network/model.py:
  VNIC_TYPE_VIRTIO_FORWARDER = 'virtio-forwarder'

openstackclient:
openstackclient/network/v2/port.py:
  choices=(...), virtio-forwarder

neutron-lib:
neutron_lib/api/definitions/portbindings.py
  VNIC_VIRTIO_FORWARDER = 'virtio-forwarder'

Task: 40435
Change-Id: Ie65f8858d6d1a1854702eb33c40ea827505bfe51

Change-Id: I94fbc9fc75e188d3a4a334ffb08836d431003764

commit_message:
Set UCA repo to Victoria

Since UCA provides V only for 20.04, we are not able to provide
distro installs for 18.04
Still we're leaving UCA fixed to U for bionic to get required KVM
libraries and other dependencies.

Change-Id: I94fbc9fc75e188d3a4a334ffb08836d431003764

Add doc for Docker Alpine deployment host

A Docker based deployment host allows for integration with CI systems
for people who want to do infrastructure as code with their OSA deploy

commit_message:
Apply all sysctl settings in sysctl-container.service

"sysctl -p" only reads /etc/sysctl.conf and thus ignores settings in
/etc/sysctl.d/*.conf. From the manpage:

   --system
		  Load settings from all system configuration files.
		  /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
		  /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
		  /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
		  /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
		  /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
		  /etc/sysctl.conf

Unfortunately, SuSe doesn't support that switch (yet). Therefore, we
keep the old behaviour on there.

Change-Id: I76db20c100258d6c9104cd90e20851345229c3b5

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-06 18:57:17.000000000', 'message': 'Assert hugepages exist in domain XML

Add new checks to NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_hugepages to confirm
hugepages are present in the server XML and the page size is correct and
does not change after live migration. Added a helper
NUMALiveMigrationTest._get_hugepage_xml_element which gets hugepage XML
information for a provided server.  The test_hugepages validates the
hugepages element is present on the instance and the configured pagesize
matches the pagesize found on the host. The test also rechecks server_b
after it is live migrated to confirm the element is still present and
pagesize is accurate.

Fixed a problem in baremetal scenarios were determined ram value was a
float rather than an int. Explicitly setting it to int when providing it
to flavor creation.

Change-Id: I8fd32a68f2aea91145c0b444d1161f13ba1ae300
'}, {'created': '2020-10-12 20:45:43.000000000', 'message': 'Assert hugepages exist in domain XML

Add new checks to NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_hugepages to confirm
hugepages are present in the server XML and the page size is correct and
does not change after live migration. Added two new helper methods to
NUMALiveMigrationTest, _get_hugepage_xml_element and
_validate_hugepage_elements. The first method gets all hugepage XML
elements in the domain of a provided instance id. The second method
confirms there is only one hugepage xml element found on the instance
domain and that it is the correct page size. The testcase method
test_hugepages validates the hugepages element is present on both
instances and the configured pagesize matches the pagesize found on the
host. The test also rechecks server_b after it is live migrated to
confirm the element is still present and pagesize is accurate.

Fixed a problem in baremetal scenarios were determined ram value was a
float rather than an int. Explicitly setting it to int when providing it
to flavor creation.

Change-Id: I8fd32a68f2aea91145c0b444d1161f13ba1ae300
'}]
commit_message:
Assert hugepages exist in domain XML

Add new checks to NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_hugepages to confirm
hugepages are present in the server XML and the page size is correct and
does not change after live migration. Added two new helper methods to
NUMALiveMigrationTest, _get_hugepage_xml_element and
_validate_hugepage_elements. The first method gets all hugepage XML
elements in the domain of a provided instance id. The second method
confirms there is only one hugepage xml element found on the instance
domain and that it is the correct page size. The testcase method
test_hugepages validates the hugepages element is present on both
instances and the configured pagesize matches the pagesize found on the
host. The test also rechecks server_b after it is live migrated to
confirm the element is still present and pagesize is accurate.

Fixed a problem in baremetal scenarios were determined ram value was a
float rather than an int. Explicitly setting it to int when providing it
to flavor creation.

Change-Id: I8fd32a68f2aea91145c0b444d1161f13ba1ae300

subject: Python 3.9: isAlive is removed
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-16 07:45:39.000000000', 'message': 'Python 3.9: isAlive is removed

The Threading method isAlive was deprecated a long time ago, in the favor
of is_alive(). Though in Python 3.9, isAlive is removed. We must switch
to it. Note that is_alive() is available at least in Python 3.5 (I tried)
and probably even earlier, so switching to is_alive() is not a problem
for the Python interpreter versions currently supported by OpenStack.

Change-Id: I9d671abcd2cea9c0c726edaddcd65e1093d96731
'}]
commit_message:
Python 3.9: isAlive is removed

The Threading method isAlive was deprecated a long time ago, in the favor
of is_alive(). Though in Python 3.9, isAlive is removed. We must switch
to it. Note that is_alive() is available at least in Python 3.5 (I tried)
and probably even earlier, so switching to is_alive() is not a problem
for the Python interpreter versions currently supported by OpenStack.

Change-Id: I9d671abcd2cea9c0c726edaddcd65e1093d96731

commit_message:

For running bigger amount of ansible forks, we need to increase
ssh MaxSessions parameter for lxc hosts, since
all connections to lxc containers occur through hosts

Don't spend time to `recheck` these changes, I'll WIP'd them for awhile to realize some tests parallel tests."}, {'account_id': 27380, 'date': '2020-10-09 08:45:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(7 comments)

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27380, 'date': '2020-10-09 09:18:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I already started something like that with a different approach but didn't took the time to finalize it as I said the other day. 

Instead of grepping on the spec file for each requirements (without checking if it is a BuildRequirements or a Requirements) I extracted all Requirements into a var list (and can be done on BuildRequirements too).
Then having your reqs var list from pip info can allow to compare them directly using diff command an printing with some +/- symbols like we are doing in linting for example. 

I was achieving this using this way : 
diff -ui <(echo $list1 | tr ' ' '\n' | sort -u) <(echo $list2 | tr ' ' '\n' | sort -u)

This makes a diff between list1 and list2 without taking care of the case (-i), using +/- format (-u).
This sort the list and removes duplicates just in case to make the diff.

This is just a view, but allow human to quickly understand which on is missing where (Req to remove from spec, or Req to add to spec)


diff -ui <(echo $list1 | tr ' ' '\n' | sort -u) <(echo $list2 | tr ' ' '\n' | sort -u)"}, {'account_id': 27380, 'date': '2020-10-09 09:35:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-10-09 10:14:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

I like the idea, I have some comments on the implementation (see inline).

Also, I see the script is reporting on missing requirements, but not on extra requirements that might have been removed (e.g. in [1] it is not alerting me that six should no longer be required).

In the RDO world, Joel has been working on "rdopkg reqcheck", which fits a similar purpose. Joel, anything to comment on your side? Do you think it might be applicable to the rpm-packaging use case?

[1] - https://review.opendev.org/758511'}]

"}, {'created': '2020-10-09 21:17:44.000000000', 'message': "Adding tool and zuul job to compare requirements

Features:
- Adding a new tool to allow us to compare package requirements.
- Adding a new zuul job to run the tool against the HEAD of each PS

For now it will only check for runtime requirements but we could easily
add testing requirements checks in a second time.

It could help us to catch missing requirements.

Locally if unstagged changes exist then the tool will analyze them
(modified files).

On CI check will be against the HEAD of patch set.

Also you can run this tool against a specific git sha to analyze if all
requirements are there for a specific commit.

In a second time I'll spend time to design a pre-commit hook to trigger
this check before submit our patches and avoid back and forth with our CI.

Example with a specific commit:

```
$ tox -e check-reqs -- --sha=87bcc8f1cf62f23beb79120c51373837896e5855
...
```

- Adding a new zuul job to run the tool against the HEAD of each PS

For now it will only check for runtime requirements but we could easily
add testing requirements checks in a second time.

It could help us to catch missing requirements.

Locally if unstagged changes exist then the tool will analyze them
(modified files).

On CI check will be against the HEAD of patch set.

Also you can run this tool against a specific git sha to analyze if all
requirements are there for a specific commit.

In a second time I'll spend time to design a pre-commit hook to trigger
this check before submit our patches and avoid back and forth with our CI.

commit_message:
[WIP] Adding tool and zuul job to compare requirements

Features:
- Adding a new tool to allow us to compare package requirements.
- Adding a new zuul job to run the tool against the HEAD of each PS

For now it will only check for runtime requirements but we could easily
add testing requirements checks in a second time.

It could help us to catch missing requirements.

Locally if unstagged changes exist then the tool will analyze them
(modified files).

On CI check will be against the HEAD of patch set.

Also you can run this tool against a specific git sha to analyze if all
requirements are there for a specific commit.

In a second time I'll spend time to design a pre-commit hook to trigger
this check before submit our patches and avoid back and forth with our CI.

Example with a specific commit:

```
$ tox -e check-reqs -- --sha=87bcc8f1cf62f23beb79120c51373837896e5855
...
```

commit_message:
Fix manila tempest tests

Because of bind-to-mgmt, manila now listens only on internal/admin URL
until [1] got merged.
To fix tempest jobs in the meanwhile, we should
externaly set to use internal endpoint for interaction.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/733408

Change-Id: I664f74f370533393e351044a8ba8ef71c3c030f8
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/739646

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-22 16:03:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix tempest init logic

The tempest init was checking if the workspace/etc directory exists, and
were creating a new workspace without pass a name, the default is
workspace, but passing a --name ensure it won't break if tempest decides
to change it.
Also, the rename command only change the name in the
$HOME/.tempest/workspace.yml, it doesn't change the path for the
particular workspace. The same happens with the move command, it just
update the path on the workspace.yml file.
With this patch, the tempest workspace is being moved properly to a
workspace_$CURDATE, all the files are copied to the new workspace,
delete the old workspace directory, and call tempest init properly.

Change-Id: I8a3b79352819f5e980eaea7482cd6b1f1bfc47be
Closes-Bug: #1896126
"}, {'created': '2020-09-22 16:05:41.000000000', 'message': "Fix tempest init logic

The tempest init was checking if the workspace/etc directory exists, and
were creating a new workspace without pass a name, the default is
workspace, but passing a --name ensure it won't break if tempest decides
to change it.
Also, the rename command only change the name in the
$HOME/.tempest/workspace.yml, it doesn't change the path for the
particular workspace. The same happens with the move command, it just
update the path on the workspace.yml file.
With this patch, the tempest workspace is being moved properly to a
workspace_$CURDATE, all the files are copied to the new workspace,
delete the old workspace directory, and call tempest init properly.

Also adding tripleo upgrade job as nv for now, since this issue only
happen in upgrade jobs

Change-Id: I8a3b79352819f5e980eaea7482cd6b1f1bfc47be
Closes-Bug: #1896126
"}, {'created': '2020-09-22 19:24:36.000000000', 'message': "Fix tempest init logic

With this patch, the tempest workspace is being moved properly to a

Also adding tripleo upgrade job as nv for now, since this issue only

Also, the rename command only change the name in the
$HOME/.tempest/workspace.yml, it doesn't change the path for the
particular workspace. The same happens with the move command, it just
update the path on the workspace.yml file.
With this patch, the tempest workspace is being moved properly to a
workspace_$CURDATE, all the files are copied to the new workspace,
delete the old workspace directory, and call tempest init properly.

Also adding tripleo upgrade job as nv for now, since this issue only
happen in upgrade jobs

Change-Id: I8a3b79352819f5e980eaea7482cd6b1f1bfc47be
Closes-Bug: #1896126

commit_message:
Fix tempest init logic

The tempest init was checking if the workspace/etc directory exists, and
were creating a new workspace without pass a name, the default is
workspace, but passing a --name ensure it won't break if tempest decides
to change it.
Also, the rename command only change the name in the
$HOME/.tempest/workspace.yml, it doesn't change the path for the
particular workspace. The same happens with the move command, it just
update the path on the workspace.yml file.
With this patch, the tempest workspace is being moved properly to a
workspace_$CURDATE, all the files are copied to the new workspace,
delete the old workspace directory, and call tempest init properly.

Also adding tripleo upgrade job as nv for now, since this issue only
happen in upgrade jobs.

Change-Id: I8a3b79352819f5e980eaea7482cd6b1f1bfc47be
Closes-Bug: #1896126

The commit: Ic48aed13d9ce262cb0d06ccc1d7c79f2fd2a365a patched
_syscmd_uname in an attempt to ease development on MacOS X, however,
this non-public function was removed from Python 3.9, and now, tests
are failing with this version of Python.

Therefore, this patch removes the hack and restores sanity.

Change-Id: Ifa73c387ac1204429f30dbf755ca044761db810e
'}]
commit_message:
Revert patching _syscmd_uname

The commit: Ic48aed13d9ce262cb0d06ccc1d7c79f2fd2a365a patched
_syscmd_uname in an attempt to ease development on MacOS X, however,
this non-public function was removed from Python 3.9, and now, tests
are failing with this version of Python.

Therefore, this patch removes the hack and restores sanity.

Change-Id: Ifa73c387ac1204429f30dbf755ca044761db810e

commit_message:
Fix wrong notification between api service and httpd

nova-api service should be stopped before httpd service is started,
thus nova-api should notify httpd.

commit_message:
add min of 1 to rpc_conn_pool_size

This change add a min value of 1 to
[oslo_messaging_rabbit]/rpc_conn_pool_size
such that there is always at least 1 connection avaiable.

This change add a runtime check to ensure that
[oslo_messaging_rabbit]/rpc_conn_pool_size is greater than
or equal too [oslo_messaging_rabbit]/conn_pool_min_size

Change-Id: I2ad4b9f1d012c9f0586a932ac27d96da1bcc4e4c
Closes-Bug: #1899533
(cherry picked from commit 00d15eaeaba0ded0330cdcec7b19eee3adbfb1e1)

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python
3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove noww
 obsolete content.

Change-Id: I4a8fc095762151927cd9b0a63ba0f0af93d46b14

subject: Fix leaked file descriptors by cleaning up objects
messages: [{'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2020-10-15 17:59:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-10-15 18:59:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nRealize I'm a co-author, but this is causing an issue with tempest so need to get it in.  Also, Terry did the fix, I just tweaked it slightly."}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2020-10-19 08:31:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-15 17:59:19.000000000', 'message': "Fix leaked file descriptors by cleaning up objects

A reference to the ovsdbapp Connection object is stored on the the
API impl class and it is causing the object to stick around and
its pipe fds to never close. Ultimately, python-ovs's call to
select() is limited to 1024 file descriptors and will eventually
error out. This deletes the connection and api objects explicitly
when we are done with them.

Change-Id: I97b27eaa293fb161724d34da88b4398f8b590c33
Co-authored-by: Brian Haley <bhaley@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1894136
"}]
commit_message:
Fix leaked file descriptors by cleaning up objects

A reference to the ovsdbapp Connection object is stored on the the
API impl class and it is causing the object to stick around and
its pipe fds to never close. Ultimately, python-ovs's call to
select() is limited to 1024 file descriptors and will eventually
error out. This deletes the connection and api objects explicitly
when we are done with them.

Change-Id: I97b27eaa293fb161724d34da88b4398f8b590c33
Co-authored-by: Brian Haley <bhaley@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1894136

commit_message:
Do not test nova::migration::libvirt in 2 places

Currently behavior of the nova::migration::libvirt class is tested in
nova_migration_livirt_spec.rb, thus we don't need to test the same in
nova_compute_libvirt_spec.rb.

This patch also remove a redundant test case.

Change-Id: Iec8f2986e165ccf60f4248cbf91aa8ce20e83a53

commit_message:
Add ability to deploy designate with BIND9 servers

This change adds playbooks to enable users to deploy designate with
BIND as the front end DNS servers. It will configure and install both
designate via the os-designate playbooks and BIND via apt packages. It
lays down the appropriate configs for both to enable DNSaaS.

Change-Id: Ieb4ad2189d0940d53f023fc0a22e23faace20c6e

commit_message:
Switch collections to git installations

In order to make collection isntallation more reliable we try to
install from git now, since galaxy often timeouts.

Change-Id: Id541d7602f102a4fab0b8fe216935195d38a9baa

commit_message:
Use new openstack collection syntax

Ansible collection for openstack has changed naming convention and
has deprecarted old naming. Due to this
appear lot's of deprecation warnings like [1]

We should use new syntax to avoid such warnings.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/799121/

Change-Id: Ib6ba1b7f8b5c75507de430cb502a126d55429b3a

commit_message:
Removes deprecated lbaasv2 haproxy docs

The lbaasv2 haproxy driver was removed and deprecated,
and the only supported option at the moment is octavia.
The Kuryr-Kubernetes documentation for Kubernetes services networking was
updated to reflect this change.

Change-Id: I72811ae0b9d15c781a7cce567d29c8189832fcb7
Closes-Bug: #1899284

Tbh I see no reason in dropping it, as seems libvirt support xen even till now.
Moreover, ubuntu builds nova-compute-xen package for V and code in nova is present https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L24'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-19 15:29:10.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Drop support for Xen

This hasn't been validated upstream and there doesn't appear to be
anyone using it. It's time to drop support for this. This is mostly test
and documentation damage, though there is some other cleanup going on,
like the removal of the essentially noop 'pick_disk_driver_name' helper.

Change-Id: I8e9d6f2f0045b5b2a55aaba937f1bde22951b1e0
"}, {'created': '2020-08-19 15:35:45.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Drop support for Xen

anyone using it. It's time to drop support for this. 

Change-Id: I8e9d6f2f0045b5b2a55aaba937f1bde22951b1e0
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Drop support for Xen

This hasn't been validated upstream and there doesn't appear to be
anyone using it. It's time to drop support for this. 

Change-Id: I8e9d6f2f0045b5b2a55aaba937f1bde22951b1e0

messages:
[{'account_id': 18152, 'date': '2019-06-12 06:55:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-08-15 00:52:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

could you instead convert the kvm.conf file to a templated one so that we drop a single file?'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-07-30 20:14:11.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Mohammed Naser with the following votes:

* Code-Review-1 by Mohammed Naser <mnaser@vexxhost.com>
'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-10-19 08:02:51.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

covered with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/725880/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-12 06:55:13.000000000', 'message': 'kvm: Add option to ignore unknown MSRs

The new option is called `nova_kvm_ignore_unknown_msrs` and is set to
`True` by default.

If set to `False`, guests that try to access unhandled MSRs are likely
to crash. This happens with Windows 10 64-bit guests in particular.

Change-Id: Ib9e216dee6523ecde382b71f20ccbd80595f7aa0
Related-Bug: #1658141
'}]
commit_message:
kvm: Add option to ignore unknown MSRs

The new option is called `nova_kvm_ignore_unknown_msrs` and is set to
`True` by default.

If set to `False`, guests that try to access unhandled MSRs are likely
to crash. This happens with Windows 10 64-bit guests in particular.

Change-Id: Ib9e216dee6523ecde382b71f20ccbd80595f7aa0
Related-Bug: #1658141

commit_message:
Fix ipmitool timing argument calculation

Calculating the ipmitool `-N` and `-R` arguments from ironic.conf
[ipmi] `command_retry_timeout` and `min_command_interval` now takes
into account the 1 second interval increment that ipmitool adds on
each retry event.

Failure-path ipmitool run duration will now be just less than
`command_retry_timeout` instead of much longer.

Change-Id: Ia3d8d85497651290c62341ac121e2aa438b4ac50

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary joinedload

This patch removes an unnecessary joinedload when looking up a
load balancer from an amphora ID. This should reduce the database
load when this method is called.

Change-Id: I04bb38c657c87ace941eb6e332f58f7218980ad1

commit_message:
Follow-up on pylint upgrade

* Adds comments on pylint disabled checks
* Enable 'deprecated-method' check. We have no failures now.
* Convert global disabled checks 'no-value-for-parameter' and
  'using-constant-test' to per-comment disables.

Other cleanup would be larger and/or better to be visited separately.

Change-Id: Id47dc8de4abcc8c744d96d2accf3a2a09ae206d4

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-08 14:43:25.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic0dd23adbb6651eec0af004fafcb03251947fc97
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic0dd23adbb6651eec0af004fafcb03251947fc97

commit_message:
Remove usage of six

Remove six-library Replace the following items with Python 3 style code.
- six.iterkeys
- six.moves
- six.metaclass

Change-Id: I2409f52daf24be1aab42a6d1f77db1c1bf1dc075

subject: Enable egress direct flow for iptables_hybrid

[{'account_id': 30454, 'date': '2020-03-12 10:22:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-03-12 10:22:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

Workflow Guide: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html"}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2020-03-12 11:09:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/712640/1 : FAILURE in 46m 46s'}, {'account_id': 2733, 'date': '2020-03-30 10:39:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This patch fixes the problem when the subnet is attached to a dvr router. But there is flooding if it is not.

I think the solution in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715419 is better than the "accepted egress direct flow" way.'}, {'account_id': 30454, 'date': '2020-04-01 01:11:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> This patch fixes the problem when the subnet is attached to a dvr
 > router. But there is flooding if it is not.
 > 
 > I think the solution in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715419 is
 > better than the "accepted egress direct flow" way.

My patch just makes sure Yulong's fix patch can work for firewall_driver=iptables_hybrid, it isn't to fix MAC learning issue. You know Yulong's fix patch has been merged into multiple branches, so I think my patch is quick path to fix our current issue. I can confirm it did fix L2 and L3 flood, but MAC indeed can't be learnt.

About Li Yajie's fix patch, it is to fix MAC learning issue, it is duplicate of Yulong's fix + my fix, if you guys think Yajie's solution is better, we need to revert Yulong's merged patch and apply Yajie's.

Maybe you can help check why Yajie's patch has L3 performance drop, we don't know why so far.'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2020-04-01 06:08:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2020-04-01 06:42:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 30454, 'date': '2020-04-01 06:51:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> (3 comments)

No problem, I will update it per your comments. I'm not familiar with pep8, how can I check pep8 style issue on my local machine."}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2020-04-01 08:11:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30454, 'date': '2020-04-01 08:14:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2020-04-01 08:16:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/712640/3 : FAILURE in 1m 27s'}, {'account_id': 30454, 'date': '2020-04-01 08:19:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Uploaded patch set 2.

Yulong, I don't know you're changing when I'm changing it, sorry for conflict, I checked pep8 and uploaded update 3, it should be ok to you."}, {'account_id': 30454, 'date': '2020-04-01 08:41:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2020-04-01 08:42:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/712640/3 : FAILURE in 38s'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2020-04-01 10:20:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2733, 'date': '2020-04-01 10:55:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

When the subnet is **not** attached to a dvr router there is flooding. Bridge br-int does not learn the VM macs from the egress packets - as intended in this patch. But packets from patch-tun hit the NORMAL action. These packets are flooded because the VM macs were not learned.'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2020-04-01 12:18:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi guys, I will bring up this issue to the L3 meeting [1] today, please attend if possible.
[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/#Neutron_L3_Sub-team_Meeting'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2020-04-01 13:23:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2020-04-01 13:25:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/712640/4 : FAILURE in 40s'}, {'account_id': 30454, 'date': '2020-04-02 03:26:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi, guys, I need to figure out issues here.

Yajie is my colleague, his fix patch https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715419/ is actually duplicate of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666991/ for our user scenario, so if it is applied, for firewall_driver=iptables_hybrid, only one fix should work, but there are duplicate flows there.

I think we can base on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666991/ and add some flows to handle corner cases, which will be better.

Yajie's fix https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715419/ is also drv only if you carefully read his changes, moreover we have found it have big performance issue for L3 VM communication (i.e. vm1 in subnet1 to vm2 in subnet2).

I have verified https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666991/ + https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712640/ in our environment, it fixed all the issues we encountered (L2 flood and L3 flood, BTW, we don't have the case in which a subnet doesn't have a router).

So my idea is to submit a new commit to cover corner case Darragh O'Reilly mentioned, we needn't duplicate code and duplicate flows.

Even if L2 MAC learning  is fixed, for L3 case, we still need direct egress flows to steer the traffic to another VM in another subnet in another compute node because qrouter set static ARP entries, it never will send ARP request, so that VM (another VM in another subnet in another compute node) MAC never will be learnt unless that VM sends traffic to a VM in same subnet in this compute node, it is very likely there isn't a VM which has same subnet as that VM."}, {'account_id': 2733, 'date': '2020-04-02 08:26:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi Yi Yang, okay good. Please add me as a reviewer to any other patchsets.

About your last point:
> Even if L2 MAC learning  is fixed, for L3 case, we still need direct egress flows to steer the traffic to another VM in another subnet in another compute node...

Hmm - if I understand you correctly, that would be a fundamental change. Currently the L3 routing for east/west is done by local qrouter namespace on the sending side. 

vm1 --> ovs --> qrouter --> ovs --> tunnel --> ovs --> vm2
vm2 --> ovs --> qrouter --> ovs --> tunnel --> ovs --> vm1
 
On the sending side, ovs processes the same packet twice. Each time it has different src and dst mac addresses. So a direct flow can't be used to forward packets from VM to tunnel."}, {'account_id': 30454, 'date': '2020-04-02 08:39:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Hi Yi Yang, okay good. Please add me as a reviewer to any other
 > patchsets.
 > 
 > About your last point:
 > > Even if L2 MAC learning  is fixed, for L3 case, we still need
 > direct egress flows to steer the traffic to another VM in another
 > subnet in another compute node...
 > 
 > Hmm - if I understand you correctly, that would be a fundamental
 > change. Currently the L3 routing for east/west is done by local
 > qrouter namespace on the sending side.
 > 
 > vm1 --> ovs --> qrouter --> ovs --> tunnel --> ovs --> vm2
 > vm2 --> ovs --> qrouter --> ovs --> tunnel --> ovs --> vm1
 > 
 > On the sending side, ovs processes the same packet twice. Each time
 > it has different src and dst mac addresses. So a direct flow can't
 > be used to forward packets from VM to tunnel.

Darragh O'Reilly， here direct flow means the flow which is in table 61 for iptables_hybrid (table 59 for Yajie's patch), it will avoid default normal action and change vlan id to another subnet VLAN id and output to patch-tun, here is an example for this.

cookie=0x3a40b98b2a93627f, duration=43848.669s, table=61, n_packets=63600558, n_bytes=559586562325, priority=10,in_port=1,dl_src=fa:16:3e:c8:63:0b,dl_dst=00:00:00:00:00:00/01:00:00:00:00:00 actions=push_vlan:0x8100,set_field:4097->vlan_vid,output:37
cookie=0x3a40b98b2a93627f, duration=43814.270s, table=61, n_packets=353147, n_bytes=28560000, priority=10,in_port=5,dl_src=fa:16:3e:4a:69:d0,dl_dst=00:00:00:00:00:00/01:00:00:00:00:00 actions=push_vlan:0x8100,set_field:4097->vlan_vid,output:37
cookie=0x3a40b98b2a93627f, duration=43780.222s, table=61, n_packets=0, n_bytes=0, priority=10,in_port=3,dl_src=fa:16:3e:f6:7b:01,dl_dst=00:00:00:00:00:00/01:00:00:00:00:00 actions=push_vlan:0x8100,set_field:4097->vlan_vid,output:37
cookie=0x3a40b98b2a93627f, duration=43778.024s, table=61, n_packets=0, n_bytes=0, priority=10,in_port=4,dl_src=fa:16:3e:02:17:e8,dl_dst=00:00:00:00:00:00/01:00:00:00:00:00 actions=push_vlan:0x8100,set_field:4097->vlan_vid,output:37
cookie=0x3a40b98b2a93627f, duration=43474.241s, table=61, n_packets=350393, n_bytes=28340052, priority=10,in_port=6,dl_src=fa:16:3e:5b:0e:f0,dl_dst=00:00:00:00:00:00/01:00:00:00:00:00 actions=push_vlan:0x8100,set_field:4097->vlan_vid,output:37
cookie=0x3a40b98b2a93627f, duration=43448.240s, table=61, n_packets=350148, n_bytes=28320372, priority=10,in_port=7,dl_src=fa:16:3e:4d:62:dd,dl_dst=00:00:00:00:00:00/01:00:00:00:00:00 actions=push_vlan:0x8100,set_field:4097->vlan_vid,output:37


For Yajie's patch, it is

table=59, n_packets=3, n_bytes=294, priority=19,dl_src=fa:16:3e:6f:7b:39 actions=mod_vlan_vid:3,output:"patch-tun"

So you can see they are duplicate egress flows, my direct flows mean these flows.'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2020-04-02 09:14:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2020-04-02 09:24:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Hi, guys, I need to figure out issues here.
 > 
 > Yajie is my colleague, his fix patch https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715419/
 > is actually duplicate of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666991/ for
 > our user scenario, so if it is applied, for firewall_driver=iptables_hybrid,
 > only one fix should work, but there are duplicate flows there.
 > 

This one is the right approach, we do not need duplicated fixes.

 > I think we can base on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666991/ and
 > add some flows to handle corner cases, which will be better.

What's the corner cases?

 > 
 > Yajie's fix https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715419/ is also drv only
 > if you carefully read his changes, moreover we have found it have
 > big performance issue for L3 VM communication (i.e. vm1 in subnet1
 > to vm2 in subnet2).
 > 
 > I have verified https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666991/ +
 > https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712640/ in our environment, it fixed
 > all the issues we encountered (L2 flood and L3 flood, BTW, we don't
 > have the case in which a subnet doesn't have a router).
 > 

Please elaborate the issues' detail, I'm confusing now. What's L2 flooding? What L3 flooding? How it happen? Why related to DVR?

 > So my idea is to submit a new commit to cover corner case Darragh
 > O'Reilly mentioned, we needn't duplicate code and duplicate flows.
 > 
 > Even if L2 MAC learning  is fixed, for L3 case, we still need
 > direct egress flows to steer the traffic to another VM in another
 > subnet in another compute node because qrouter set static ARP
 > entries, it never will send ARP request, so that VM (another VM in
 > another subnet in another compute node) MAC never will be learnt
 > unless that VM sends traffic to a VM in same subnet in this compute
 > node, it is very likely there isn't a VM which has same subnet as
 > that VM.


I just want to say I'm lost now. In this comment we can see flooding issue, performance, arp, firewall_driver, cases and cases. We should handle the problem one by one in small pieces. So it's better to file new bugs for these different cases."}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2020-04-02 09:36:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Please allow me to make things clear here. In the L3 meeting, we have a conclusion. This patch will be used for iptables_hybrid driver to enable egress direct flows, aka make "explicitly_egress_direct = True" work. It will fix the "egress" (in the perspective of VM) flooding issue on br-int when iptables_hybrid securitg group driver applied.

Another is found by Darragh O'Reilly, if subnet has no router connected, it will case the a new "ingress" flooding. This will be addressed in another bug or patch.'}, {'account_id': 30454, 'date': '2020-04-02 09:43:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> > Hi, guys, I need to figure out issues here.
 > >
 > > Yajie is my colleague, his fix patch https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715419/
 > > is actually duplicate of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666991/
 > for
 > > our user scenario, so if it is applied, for firewall_driver=iptables_hybrid,
 > > only one fix should work, but there are duplicate flows there.
 > >
 > 
 > This one is the right approach, we do not need duplicated fixes.
 > 
 > > I think we can base on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666991/ and
 > > add some flows to handle corner cases, which will be better.
 > 
 > What's the corner cases?

As Darragh O'Reilly said, if a subnet isn't added into router, your fix won't install flows to handle this case. Your fix has a side effect, it blocked MAC learning. If ovs bridge can't find destination MAC in fdb table, it has to do flood unless there are special flows to steer it to patch-tun.


 > 
 > >
 > > Yajie's fix https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715419/ is also drv
 > only
 > > if you carefully read his changes, moreover we have found it have
 > > big performance issue for L3 VM communication (i.e. vm1 in
 > subnet1
 > > to vm2 in subnet2).
 > >
 > > I have verified https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666991/ +
 > > https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712640/ in our environment, it
 > fixed
 > > all the issues we encountered (L2 flood and L3 flood, BTW, we
 > don't
 > > have the case in which a subnet doesn't have a router).
 > >
 > 
 > Please elaborate the issues' detail, I'm confusing now. What's L2
 > flooding? What L3 flooding? How it happen? Why related to DVR?
 > 

DVR blocked MAC learning, this is root cause, in your environment, you can check it by "ovs-appctl fdb/show br-int", in non-DVR mode or in the case a subnet isn't added into router, it should show all learnt MACs from local VMs and remote VMs.

L2 flood means ovs bridge will flood the traffic to all the local VMs in same subnet, your egress direct flow just fixes this issue.

L3 flood means different subnet VM traffic, it also will flood to local VMs in same subnet as destination VM is in unless you installed egress direct flow to handle it.

 > > So my idea is to submit a new commit to cover corner case Darragh
 > > O'Reilly mentioned, we needn't duplicate code and duplicate
 > flows.
 > >
 > > Even if L2 MAC learning  is fixed, for L3 case, we still need
 > > direct egress flows to steer the traffic to another VM in another
 > > subnet in another compute node because qrouter set static ARP
 > > entries, it never will send ARP request, so that VM (another VM
 > in
 > > another subnet in another compute node) MAC never will be learnt
 > > unless that VM sends traffic to a VM in same subnet in this
 > compute
 > > node, it is very likely there isn't a VM which has same subnet as
 > > that VM.
 > 
 > 
 > I just want to say I'm lost now. In this comment we can see
 > flooding issue, performance, arp, firewall_driver, cases and cases.
 > We should handle the problem one by one in small pieces. So it's
 > better to file new bugs for these different cases.

The root cause is DVR blocked MAC learning, no MAC in ovs bridge fdb table, so ovs bridge will flood it to many of ports, this is the flood,the flood the same subnet VM results in is L2 flood, the flood different subnet VM results in is L3 flood.'}, {'account_id': 30454, 'date': '2020-04-02 09:46:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Please allow me to make things clear here. In the L3 meeting, we
 > have a conclusion. This patch will be used for iptables_hybrid
 > driver to enable egress direct flows, aka make "explicitly_egress_direct
 > = True" work. It will fix the "egress" (in the perspective of VM)
 > flooding issue on br-int when iptables_hybrid securitg group driver
 > applied.
 > 
 > Another is found by Darragh O'Reilly, if subnet has no router
 > connected, it will case the a new "ingress" flooding. This will be
 > addressed in another bug or patch.

Yes, this is the conclusion we all agreed.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2020-04-02 09:58:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py#L2135

    def process_install_ports_egress_flows(self, ports):
        if not self.conf.AGENT.explicitly_egress_direct:
            return

        if (isinstance(self.sg_agent.firewall,
                       agent_firewall.NoopFirewallDriver) or
                not agent_sg_rpc.is_firewall_enabled()):
            with self.int_br.deferred(full_ordered=True,
^^^                                      use_bundle=True) as int_br:
                for port in ports:
                    try:
                        self.install_accepted_egress_direct_flow(port, int_br)
                        # give other coroutines a chance to run
                        eventlet.sleep(0)
                    except Exception as err:
                        LOG.debug("Failed to install accepted egress flows "
                                  "for port %s, error: %s",
                                  port['port_id'], err)

use_bundle=true means it needs OPENFLOW14, for the case firewall_driver=openvswitch, it has added OPENFLOW14 to br-int by default, so you didn't notice that. These flows can't be installed to br-int if br-int doesn't have OPENFLOW14 support.'}, {'account_id': 30454, 'date': '2020-04-08 01:46:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2020-04-08 01:47:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Hi Yi and Liu, can you see the latest comment I posted on this bug and the original for OVS based firewall?

I have a question about where we can enable this option. Can we enable it on a dvr_snat node that is hosting SNAT routers but one that is not HA? Or can it only be enabled on regular DVR nodes that host qrouter and fip? 

Furthermore, what are specifically issues it causes with HA routers and centralized FIPs?  Will it always break an SNAT router hosting centralized Floating IPs, or only when this is an HA router as well...?

The original commit doc isn't clear about the effects of turning this on"}, {'account_id': 30454, 'date': '2020-04-29 00:26:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> Hi Yi and Liu, can you see the latest comment I posted on this bug

 > host qrouter and fip?
 >

 > and centralized FIPs?  Will it always break an SNAT router hosting
 > centralized Floating IPs, or only when this is an HA router as
 > well...?
 > 
 > The original commit doc isn't clear about the effects of turning
 > this on

I'm not sure your dvr_snat node is compute node or neutron network node, if it is SNAT gateway, I don't think you need to enable this in that node.

I suggest you try this patch and check what happens."}, {'account_id': 21907, 'date': '2020-04-29 01:47:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

I guess I'm confused by the terminology. In DVR, isn't every node a compute node and a network node? I thought "network node" referred only to nodes in a non-DVR topology, where dedicated network nodes hosts centralized l3-agent (and all routers) and DHCP services. 

But in DVR we have the router and FIP namespace located on same nodes as VMs. One of these nodes will also host the snat namespace (based on the l3 agent scheduler), and some will have DHCP services running. we aren't dedicating one entire node to only host SNAT but no VMs'}, {'account_id': 30454, 'date': '2020-04-29 02:38:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> I guess I'm confused by the terminology. In DVR, isn't every node a
 > compute node and a network node? I thought "network node" referred
 > only to nodes in a non-DVR topology, where dedicated network nodes
 > hosts centralized l3-agent (and all routers) and DHCP services.
 > 
 > But in DVR we have the router and FIP namespace located on same
 > nodes as VMs. One of these nodes will also host the snat namespace
 > (based on the l3 agent scheduler), and some will have DHCP services
 > running. we aren't dedicating one entire node to only host SNAT but
 > no VMs

Got it, for our deployment, we have dedicated network nodes for snat, l3, DHCP, metadata, for these nodes, agent mode is dvr_snat

/etc/neutron/l3_agent.ini:agent_mode = dvr_snat

For your case, can you show me your /etc/neutron/l3_agent.ini with dvr_snat enabled? I think you only can set agent_mode to dvr or dvr_snat, how do you enable dvr and dvr_snat in an l3 agent config file, they can't coexist.

For you case, I think you can turn on it (explicitly_egress_direct = True), please let me know if you have any issue.'}, {'account_id': 21907, 'date': '2020-04-29 02:53:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Yi, the good news is patch works on both compute nodes hosting SNAT namespace and not. And without it, we see the flooding, regardless of whether snat router is present or not.

with dvr_snat, the node can also host VMs. We just assign some subset of nodes typically as dvr_snat, the others are just agent_mode = dvr. Same goes for DHCP - we assign some subset (say, at minimum 3) to run DHCP agent. The neutron schedulers will then actually deploy the snat/dhcp namespaces to one or more of them.

My concern was the comment on the original commit (not yours): https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666991/13/releasenotes/notes/accepted_egress_direct-cc23873e213c6919.yaml

"A new config option ``explicitly_egress_direct``, with default value False,
    was added for the aim of distinguishing clouds which are running the
    network node mixed with compute services, upstream neutron CI should be
    an example. In such situation, this ``explicitly_egress_direct`` should be
    set to False, because there are numerous cases from HA routers which can
    not be covered, particularly when you have centralized floating IPs running
    in such mixed hosts."

That description is a bit vague and I don't understand it. We have "network node" mixed with compute. Does this mean we should always set this? Or is that *only* the case if we use HA snat routers? Or is it *only* the case with centralized Floating IP AND an HA snat router?

We definitely see the flooding issue on compute nodes hosting SNAT. And with this fix, the issue definitely goes away. I am worried about these corner cases arising from HA routers, centralized FIPs, etc... as stated in the comment. We can turn the option off on nodes set to agent_mode = dvr_snat, but then we'd have several nodes in each deployment still affected'}, {'account_id': 21907, 'date': '2020-04-29 02:59:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

snat functionality is not broken either, both for VMs located on same node as snat router and remote host. so that is good too.

but i've yet to test more complicated topologies (HA, centralized floating IPs)"}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2020-06-09 03:14:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2020-06-09 03:57:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/712640/9 : FAILURE in 42m 53s'}, {'account_id': 21907, 'date': '2020-06-23 07:18:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

We are seeing ingress flooding occur due to enabling this fix on other networks. We have a VLAN based network, both attached and unattached to a DVR router. In both cases, on ingress the NORMAL action at table=60 is hit. 

This is because for a provider network, there are no dvr MAC rules with an explicit output: action to a local port. In DVR subnet, these rules are added with the EXTERNAL vlan/segmentation ID. Not with the local vlan. However, there is a table=0, priority=3 rule which converts from the external VLAN to host local VLAN. 

NORMAL action at table=60 for ingress, requires the local VM MACs to be learned. But these are never learned, because the fix resubmits egress packets to table 61, which has a direct output: action northbound.

So now we have flooding in opposite direction. But we still need this fix because in other scenarios, we see the egress flooding.

https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1884708'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2020-09-25 15:40:40.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This review is > 4 weeks without comment, and failed Zuul jobs the last time it was checked. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}, {'account_id': 30454, 'date': '2020-09-27 00:47:52.000000000', 'content': "Restored

From source code in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738551/, it seems this isn't needed any more, @LIU Yulong, please help double confirm, thanks a lot."}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2020-10-15 15:05:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

commit_message:
Enable egress direct flow for iptables_hybrid

When enable explicitly_egress_direct for iptables_hybrid security group
driver, the egress flooding still occurs on br-int. This patch adds the
iptables_hybrid to the driver check list to ensure the direct flows are
installed properly.

These direct flows also need br-int to support OPENFLOW14 because they
are installed by using bundle, so this patch also adds required protocols
to br-int. Note: only OPENFLOW10 and OPENFLOW13 are added for br-int in
case of firewall_driver=iptables_hybrid.

Related-Bug: #1732067
Related-Bug: #1866445

Co-Authored-By: LIU Yulong <i@liuyulong.me>

Change-Id: I9cc05e9e89b806263e9cba31ed9e16b1d2b455f6
Signed-off-by: Yi Yang <yangyi01@inspur.com>

[{'created': '2020-09-19 14:10:06.000000000', 'message': "Remove use_2to3 backward compat for Setuptools

Odds are this was never used by any PBR-based projects, but was
included from the beginning to support a feature of Setuptools for a
utility which has been long since discouraged. As of Setuptools
46.2.0 and Python 3.9 it's generating deprecation warnings, and is
slated for removal from the Python 3.10 standard library.

https://bugs.python.org/issue40360
https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/2086

Change-Id: I6972984f29413d2534d802b142fa9323a7e4a4a3
"}]
commit_message:
Remove use_2to3 backward compat for Setuptools

Odds are this was never used by any PBR-based projects, but was
included from the beginning to support a feature of Setuptools for a
utility which has been long since discouraged. As of Setuptools
46.2.0 and Python 3.9 it's generating deprecation warnings, and is
slated for removal from the Python 3.10 standard library.

https://bugs.python.org/issue40360
https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/2086

Change-Id: I6972984f29413d2534d802b142fa9323a7e4a4a3

commit_message:
Improve pip install process for offline deployment.

    * "Use distribution-provided pip"
    * "Use python's pip module invocation method"
    * "Install pip earlier in order to avoid multiple installation"
    * "Remove pip_version variable requirement and call"

Change-Id: Id0e738044a1931f9d611a7281a48ea4a593f1cf1
Closes-bug: #1893204
(cherry picked from commit b93c40a3635fbce72e48dc29120e50484cba36ca)

commit_message:
Remove six usage and  basestring check

Remove basestring check.
Remove six Replace the following items with Python 3 style code.

- six.string_types
- six.int2byte
- six.indexbytes
- six.add_metaclass
- six.StringIO
- six.text_type
- six.integer_types
- six.binary_type
- six.BytesIO
- six.reraise

Change-Id: I4fb9033d152963c504ceb4d5c4d08f934ee4accb

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-19 13:48:47.000000000', 'message': "More easy_install.ScriptWriter.get_header()

Setuptools 12.0 deprecated easy_install.get_script_header() when it
was released five years ago, and if called with PYTHONWARNINGS=error
raises a deprecation exception. Switch to the preferred class
method, but keep the original call as a fallback since it won't work
on older Setuptools versions (such as the 3.3 shipped with Ubuntu
Trusty). This continues 9a219f9a4f47243123d50d30938506bcc792e55d to
remove a second call for the same deprecated function.

Change-Id: I365075c2cff88283f92298ce2f5e53d263dc7f4b
"}]
commit_message:
More easy_install.ScriptWriter.get_header()

Setuptools 12.0 deprecated easy_install.get_script_header() when it
was released five years ago, and if called with PYTHONWARNINGS=error
raises a deprecation exception. Switch to the preferred class
method, but keep the original call as a fallback since it won't work
on older Setuptools versions (such as the 3.3 shipped with Ubuntu
Trusty). This continues 9a219f9a4f47243123d50d30938506bcc792e55d to
remove a second call for the same deprecated function.

Change-Id: I365075c2cff88283f92298ce2f5e53d263dc7f4b

which have been dropped in Focal in favor of their python3-.*
replacements. Switch this job to Bionic where those packages still
exist.

tempest-full-py3) so will want to install Python library packages
which have been dropped in Focal in favor of their python3-.*

Change-Id: Id95eaae9351e8664aa1fa48a7b4bf59e4c463834
'}, {'created': '2020-10-16 21:32:08.000000000', 'message': 'Run tempest-full for stable/train

The tempest-full job runs Python 2.7 (as opposed to
tempest-full-py3) so will want to install Python library packages
which have been dropped in Focal in favor of their python3-.*
replacements. Switch this job to use stable/train branches of
required projects as they still expected 2.7 to work, and as a side
effect this will cause the appropriate nodeset to be chosen
automatically.

Change-Id: Id95eaae9351e8664aa1fa48a7b4bf59e4c463834
'}]
commit_message:
Run tempest-full for stable/train

The tempest-full job runs Python 2.7 (as opposed to
tempest-full-py3) so will want to install Python library packages
which have been dropped in Focal in favor of their python3-.*
replacements. Switch this job to use stable/train branches of
required projects as they still expected 2.7 to work, and as a side
effect this will cause the appropriate nodeset to be chosen
automatically.

Change-Id: Id95eaae9351e8664aa1fa48a7b4bf59e4c463834

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I76b2c144f6b2d7fb6b4ddf7b91bfd52c455e11d5

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I0f8c2a33e45f36b9ed4a562d1c6d15bdddce66ca

commit_message:
Add new classes ovs_driver and sriov_driver

Those classes handles ML2 plugin's configuration related to the
OVS and SR-IOV mechanism drivers.
Previously there was neutron::plugins::ml2::mech_driver function which
was used by neutron::plugins::ml2 class but it isn't used at all
currently and probably it will need to be deprecated and removed in
follow up patch(es).

Change-Id: I2a321fb780e789b7556d557e2170a3267049c432
(cherry picked from commit 0b8a90ec5c4cdac145672150ee4d58f7959cf6bb)
