[{'created': '2020-10-09 17:09:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix container test image

The test container is failing to execute ping on environments that
do not allow containers to run as root user (e.g. OpenShift 4.6).
This commit fixes the issue by ensuring iputils package from Alpine
is installed. Also, it upgrades packages versions.

Change-Id: I1f429110c888103734ce6657fea729529389eb1f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix container test image

The test container is failing to execute ping on environments that
do not allow containers to run as root user (e.g. OpenShift 4.6).
This commit fixes the issue by ensuring iputils package from Alpine
is installed. Also, it upgrades packages versions.

Change-Id: I1f429110c888103734ce6657fea729529389eb1f

subject: drop tempest-full
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Mann', 'email': 'gmann@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2020-10-10 23:09:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2020-10-10 23:13:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2020-10-10 23:34:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

PBR should continue to support python2 for older versions of openstack. Instead of completely removing this job maybe we should replace it with a python2 tempest-full run on the train branch. That way we continue to get decent python2 coverage but in a context where we expect python2 to be functional?'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-10-12 15:17:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> PBR should continue to support python2 for older versions of
 > openstack. Instead of completely removing this job maybe we should
 > replace it with a python2 tempest-full run on the train branch.
 > That way we continue to get decent python2 coverage but in a
 > context where we expect python2 to be functional?

I like that option. We have traditionally tried to keep pbr compatible with as many releases of Python as possible, so I'd rather not drop Python 2 testing completely as long as there is still a lot of software out there using it."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-10-16 18:16:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It looks to me like it might just work if we switched the node type back to ubuntu-bionic. It's failing to install distro packaged Python libraries because it wants the ones packaged for Python 2.7 which no longer exist on Focal."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-10-16 18:22:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm testing the nodeset rollback with Id95eaae9351e8664aa1fa48a7b4bf59e4c463834 to see if it can provide a quick stopgap solution."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-10-16 18:47:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I'm testing the nodeset rollback with Id95eaae9351e8664aa1fa48a7b4bf59e4c463834
 > to see if it can provide a quick stopgap solution.

tempest-full is not supposed to be run on master gate if we want to cover the py2 testing via tempest-full then we need to run this with train setup as Clark suggested. running it with bionic on master code set which does not support py2 can cause other issues."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-10-16 18:52:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ghanshyam Mann wrote:

> tempest-full is not supposed to be run on master gate if we want to
> cover the py2 testing via tempest-full then we need to run this with
> train setup as Clark suggested. running it with bionic on master
> code set which does not support py2 can cause other issues.

I'll see if I can work out how to do that."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-10-16 18:55:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Ghanshyam Mann wrote:
 > 
 > > tempest-full is not supposed to be run on master gate if we want
 > to
 > > cover the py2 testing via tempest-full then we need to run this
 > with
 > > train setup as Clark suggested. running it with bionic on master
 > > code set which does not support py2 can cause other issues.
 > 
 > I'll see if I can work out how to do that.

better is just define a new job derived from tempest-full by branch overridden something like tempest-full-train or tempest-full-py2-train. that is how we test supported stable branch on Tempest master. - https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/181ae6521649bd865c2ee7c4e87690aab29567e8/.zuul.yaml#L475"}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-10-16 23:30:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks for the suggestion, looks like override-checkout in a variant does the trick. Change Id95eaae9351e8664aa1fa48a7b4bf59e4c463834 is passing now!'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2020-10-18 15:01:02.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoned in favor of Id95eaae9351e8664aa1fa48a7b4bf59e4c463834'}]

commit_message:
drop tempest-full

According to Jens Harbott (frickler) in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/757127
tempest-full job should no longer be used.

Change-Id: I5c91a01b9fa1a339a8a272343b5c3729ec990861
Signed-off-by: Moisés Guimarães de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-08 14:37:53.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I374fabd0d15f75e8df01fca382b993ba976d7b05
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I374fabd0d15f75e8df01fca382b993ba976d7b05

Those classes handles ML2 plugin's configuration related to the
OVS and SR-IOV mechanism drivers.
Previously there was neutron::plugins::ml2::mech_driver function which
was used by neutron::plugins::ml2 class but it isn't used at all
currently and probably it will need to be deprecated and removed in
follow up patch(es).

"}]
commit_message:
Add new classes ovs_driver and sriov_driver

Those classes handles ML2 plugin's configuration related to the
OVS and SR-IOV mechanism drivers.
Previously there was neutron::plugins::ml2::mech_driver function which
was used by neutron::plugins::ml2 class but it isn't used at all
currently and probably it will need to be deprecated and removed in
follow up patch(es).

Change-Id: I2a321fb780e789b7556d557e2170a3267049c432
(cherry picked from commit 0b8a90ec5c4cdac145672150ee4d58f7959cf6bb)

Thanks Rajat and Lucio for the careful reviews.  Third party CI is reporting and shows that the multiattach tests are passing.

Ajitha, you may want to take care of Lucio's comment about the docs as a follow-up.  You do mention the change from nimble-specific to the general multiattach extra spec in the release note, but it would probably be useful for operators to also have the info handy in you driver's docs."}, {'account_id': 16186, 'date': '2020-09-04 11:35:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

 > in you driver's docs.

Hi Brian,
Sure. Thank you"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-09-15 18:05:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Add multiattach in Nimble driver

Implements: blueprint nimble-add-multiattach-support

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-08 12:32:55.000000000', 'message': '[Stable only] Drop *-master jobs

commit_message:
[Stable only] Drop *-master jobs

These jobs are used to test neutron against current master branches of
external projects (OVS/OVN, os-ken).

Stable branches are not expected to run with this setup so we can drop
the jobs there (especially as some of these jobs are periodic ones).

Change-Id: I3e2a0c6d14b49e8e627589cab899dbf7e13e5143

commit_message:
Simplify scheduler filter additions

Add 'nova_scheduler_extra_filters' to allow operators to enable
additional scheduler filters without overriding the entire list of
filters as in [0].

This also reduces the burden on ops to maintain the list of overridden
default schedulers because of things like [1].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/limestone-ci-cloud/blob/3886dbc40de036e7d1e3bb61917793d7067a89b2/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml#L51-L69
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/596502/

Change-Id: I9ab6bcbef2b496df7f6ecf11a7d8f5f7891aeeca
(cherry picked from commit 1958a954b989e391567be4632d794c22ce03bff6)

commit_message:
Fix python interpreter bug for designate source installs on train

When performing post install tasks, the openstacksdk is
imported using a python2 interpreter in a Ubuntu Bionic utility
container (as a result of a fallback to
ansible_python['executable']). This fails as the utility container
has been set up using python3.

This patch corrects the python interpreter to match the variable
already used in service_setup.yml. This is a partial backport of
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/745696/

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/756057
Change-Id: I3a4a1823a9c9a05164e8a1654a5c39d6c935bbb9

commit_message:
Remove unsupported OS

Do some role cleanup to path for not supported OS,
like gentoo or suse.
This includes bionic distro jobs, since this path is not supported
for bionic in Victoria

Fix ansible linter errors as a result of linter update.

Change-Id: I619dc6da251bd9d6f9d117e7b0cdedc2e59bf581

commit_message:
Disable dstat service temporary in ovn scenario jobs

Multinode OVN jobs are failing very often due to bug [1] so
lets disable dstat service in those jobs for now as workaround
of the problem.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/dstat/+bug/1866619

Change-Id: Id9bb16d9e3e649e1538bc33bd1b7e8eab7e74048
Closes-Bug: #1898863

[{'created': '2020-08-25 21:48:44.000000000', 'message': 'Removes the delta file once image is extracted

When creating a live snapshot of an instance, nova creates a
copy of the instance disk using a QEMU shallow rebase. This
copy - the delta file - is then extracted and uploaded. The
delta file will eventually be deleted, when the temporary
working directory nova is using for the live snapshot is
discarded, however, until this happens, we will use 3x the
size of the image of host disk space: the original disk,
the delta file, and the extracted file. This can be problematic
when concurrent snapshots of multiple instances are requested
at once.

The solution is simple: delete the delta file after it has
been extracted and is no longer necessary.

Change-Id: I15e9975fa516d81e7d34206e5a4069db5431caa9
Closes-Bug: #1881727
(cherry picked from commit d2af7ca7a5c862f53f18c00ac76fc85336fa79e6)

commit_message:
Removes the delta file once image is extracted

When creating a live snapshot of an instance, nova creates a
copy of the instance disk using a QEMU shallow rebase. This
copy - the delta file - is then extracted and uploaded. The
delta file will eventually be deleted, when the temporary
working directory nova is using for the live snapshot is
discarded, however, until this happens, we will use 3x the
size of the image of host disk space: the original disk,
the delta file, and the extracted file. This can be problematic
when concurrent snapshots of multiple instances are requested
at once.

The solution is simple: delete the delta file after it has
been extracted and is no longer necessary.

Change-Id: I15e9975fa516d81e7d34206e5a4069db5431caa9
Closes-Bug: #1881727
(cherry picked from commit d2af7ca7a5c862f53f18c00ac76fc85336fa79e6)
(cherry picked from commit e51555b3f0324b8b72a2b3280a1c30e104b6d8ea)

commit_message:
compute: Lock by instance.uuid lock during swap_volume

The libvirt driver is currently the only virt driver implementing swap
volume within Nova. While libvirt itself does support moving between
multiple volumes attached to the same instance at the same time the
current logic within the libvirt driver makes a call to
virDomainGetXMLDesc that fails if there are active block jobs against
any disk attached to the domain.

This change simply uses an instance.uuid based lock in the compute layer
to serialise requests to swap_volume to avoid this from being possible.

Closes-Bug: #1896621
Change-Id: Ic5ce2580e7638a47f1ffddb4edbb503bf490504c

commit_message:
Clean up the DynamicVendorData constructor

There are a bunch of unused parameters in DynamicVendorData constructor
and a comment that they cannot be removed due to JsonFileVendorData. But
JsonFileVendorData does not depends on those paramters and both the
base class and JsonFileVendorData uses *args **kwargs. So it is safe to
remove the unused params.

The context field of DynamicVendorData is also removed as it is unused.
This makes the request_context parameter of the InstanceMeta
constructor also unused so that is removed.

Change-Id: Ie27fd6a5513e53903b9acd5d63038b3b484acbde

commit_message:
Add tripleo_states to default callback whitelist

tripleo_states will be a useful callback to print out informations about
a deployment state (e.g. if a node failed but was ignored because of
max_failed_percentage).

Change-Id: I82f4945bf1178fad1ff511c994518008f308d12e
(cherry picked from commit c1dad1ced1fffe3c8e8ec727fc81ccb601b61b8a)

bindep: Install python3 and python3-devel on CentOS 8 and Fedora

python-devel is no longer available on either distro, both should now
use python3 and python3-devel packages.

[{'created': '2020-10-16 18:14:38.000000000', 'message': '[ceph-osd] Synchronization audit for the ceph-volume osd-init script

attempts to resolve those and stabilize the script when multiple
instances run simultaneously on the same host.

commit_message:
[ceph-osd] Synchronization audit for the ceph-volume osd-init script

There are race conditions in the ceph-volume osd-init script that
occasionally cause deployment and OSD restart issues. This change
attempts to resolve those and stabilize the script when multiple
instances run simultaneously on the same host.

Change-Id: I79407059fa20fb51c6840717a083a8dc616ba410

messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-10-13 10:47:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-10-13 12:40:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-10-13 15:27:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-10-13 18:13:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-10-14 08:39:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-10-14 10:53:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-10-16 18:30:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-13 10:47:32.000000000', 'message': 'Performance: use a single config file for fluentd

Currently we generate multiple fluentd configuration files for inputs,
filters, formatters and outputs.
These are then included from the main td-agent.conf configuration file.
With a large number of hosts, this can take a long time to template.

Benchmarking of templating is available at [1].

This change switches to a single fluentd configuration file, with the
include done locally. For the default template files included with Kolla
Ansible we use Jinja includes, but this does not work with templates in
a different directory. We therefore use the Ansible template lookup
plugin, which has a slightly higher overhead than a jinja include, but
far lower than generating multiple templates. This should drastically
improve the performance of this task.

[1] https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-scaling/blob/master/doc/template.md

Partially-Implements: blueprint performance-improvements

commit_message:
Performance: use a single config file for fluentd

Backport note: moved filter directly into common role since Python
import of kolla_ansible modules from Ansible does not work in Stein.

Currently we generate multiple fluentd configuration files for inputs,
filters, formatters and outputs.
These are then included from the main td-agent.conf configuration file.
With a large number of hosts, this can take a long time to template.

Benchmarking of templating is available at [1].

This change switches to a single fluentd configuration file, with the
include done locally. For the default template files included with Kolla
Ansible we use Jinja includes, but this does not work with templates in
a different directory. We therefore use the Ansible template lookup
plugin, which has a slightly higher overhead than a jinja include, but
far lower than generating multiple templates. This should drastically
improve the performance of this task.

[1] https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-scaling/blob/master/doc/template.md

Partially-Implements: blueprint performance-improvements

Change-Id: Ia8623be0aa861fea3e54d2c9e1c971dfd8e3afa9
(cherry picked from commit 56a07702bcea02cf3793d6c830acc687b68244be)

commit_message:
Lower ansible poll interval time

Currently we set poll interval in ansible to 0.05 which means it'll wait
50ms.  The default is 0.001 which at scale is too cpu intensive.  That
being said, waiting 50ms for each task across all hosts increases
overall execution time. Let's lower it to 0.01 as a middle ground
between the current 0.05 and the 0.001 default.

Change-Id: Ie4268fcc8c1a8031eaf7c33e9c137c198017ee18

commit_message:
Remove glance_registry from inventory

Glance registry has been completely removed in ussuri,
so it's time to clean it up from the integrated
repo.

Change-Id: I9b7c5ebe93df9c9ba3a8be9a9acd590fbb18c5f7

We don't actually care about the files in the suffix dirs, just how many

commit_message:
Optimize swift-recon-cron a bit

We don't actually care about the files in the suffix dirs, just how many
there are. So don't count the names; look at the link count (deducting
one for '.')

Change-Id: If2b35925d790429968d8d68780072acdc6dc9631

(2 comments)

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > Another pass through this. My main concern now is that we always
 > restart both keepalived and haproxy. It would be nice to be able to
 > reconfigure haproxy without touching keepalived and moving the VIP.

True that, but that is best done with reloads, restarts should move the VIP in an orderly fashion (like here) to ensure best coverage.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-08-12 10:46:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > > (2 comments)
 > >
 > > Another pass through this. My main concern now is that we always
 > > restart both keepalived and haproxy. It would be nice to be able
 > to
 > > reconfigure haproxy without touching keepalived and moving the
 > VIP.
 > 
 > True that, but that is best done with reloads, restarts should move
 > the VIP in an orderly fashion (like here) to ensure best coverage.

I agree that a reload would be ideal, but until we have it this would be a regression.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-08-24 18:59:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

honestly, Mark, this makes kolla actions less fragile - I just hit a cluster stall with keepalived moving VIP before haproxy could close the connections; the root cause is services having no handling of mariadb timeouts (or them very long) but this patch actually takes the pain away at least when running kolla-ansible (running reboot not included)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-08-24 19:23:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> honestly, Mark, this makes kolla actions less fragile - I just hit
 > a cluster stall with keepalived moving VIP before haproxy could
 > close the connections; the root cause is services having no
 > handling of mariadb timeouts (or them very long) but this patch
 > actually takes the pain away at least when running kolla-ansible
 > (running reboot not included)

I won't dispute that, I'd just rather see us do a simple haproxy restart if possible rather than this full dance."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-08-24 19:26:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-08-25 07:16:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

ok, I think I see what you want now; will take a look, it might be still fixing the issue I am hitting and making you happy at the same time;

anyhow, I seem to have understood the stall better - if services already spawned all their workers which connected to mariadb and this connection was lost with no notification (e.g. just VIP move), then all requests will simply hang until services discover that mariadb is really, really gone - I need to check if we have a way to configure this timeout, it really is absurd because HA is only provisional as VIP failure will always trigger a stall if the cluster was used regularly'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-08-25 08:21:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> ok, I think I see what you want now; will take a look, it might be
 > still fixing the issue I am hitting and making you happy at the
 > same time;
 > 
 > anyhow, I seem to have understood the stall better - if services
 > already spawned all their workers which connected to mariadb and
 > this connection was lost with no notification (e.g. just VIP move),
 > then all requests will simply hang until services discover that
 > mariadb is really, really gone - I need to check if we have a way
 > to configure this timeout, it really is absurd because HA is only
 > provisional as VIP failure will always trigger a stall if the
 > cluster was used regularly

Pierre investigated this issue recently. I think he ended up dialling the connection pool down to 1. I'll see if he wants to upstream it."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-09-02 17:18:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

hey Pierre, please look at comment above, thanks'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-09-02 17:34:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-09-02 17:34:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-27 08:44:09.000000000', 'message': "Do not restart keepalived on haproxy config change

This is partial fix to the general bug regarding Ansible handling
of notifications with loops.
As keepalived is a crucial service, let's not restart it too much.

Change-Id: I22ddec5f7ee4a7d3d502649a158a7e005fe29c48
Partial-Bug: #1863510
"}, {'created': '2020-04-27 19:32:58.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Coordinate haproxy and keepalived restarts

Keepalived and haproxy cooperate to provide control plane HA in
kolla-ansible deployments.
Certain care should be exerted to avoid prolonged availability
loss during reconfigurations and upgrades.
This patch aims to provide this care.
There is nothing special about keepalived upgrade compared to
reconfig, hence it is simplified to run the same code as for
deploy.
The broken logic of safe upgrade is replaced by common handler
code which's goal is to ensure we down current master only after
we have backups ready.

This includes a partial fix to the general bug regarding Ansible
handling of notifications with loops.

Change-Id: I22ddec5f7ee4a7d3d502649a158a7e005fe29c48
Partial-Bug: #1863510
"}, {'created': '2020-04-28 17:26:41.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Coordinate haproxy and keepalived restarts

"}, {'created': '2020-05-01 19:36:50.000000000', 'message': "Coordinate haproxy and keepalived restarts

Keepalived and haproxy cooperate to provide control plane HA in
kolla-ansible deployments.
Certain care should be exerted to avoid prolonged availability
loss during reconfigurations and upgrades.
This patch aims to provide this care.
There is nothing special about keepalived upgrade compared to
reconfig, hence it is simplified to run the same code as for
deploy.
The broken logic of safe upgrade is replaced by common handler
code which's goal is to ensure we down current master only after
we have backups ready.

This change introduces a switch to kolla_docker module that allows
to ignore missing containers (as they are logically stopped).
ignore_missing is the switch's name.
All tests are included.

Change-Id: I22ddec5f7ee4a7d3d502649a158a7e005fe29c48

commit_message:
Coordinate haproxy and keepalived restarts

Keepalived and haproxy cooperate to provide control plane HA in
kolla-ansible deployments.
Certain care should be exerted to avoid prolonged availability
loss during reconfigurations and upgrades.
This patch aims to provide this care.
There is nothing special about keepalived upgrade compared to
reconfig, hence it is simplified to run the same code as for
deploy.
The broken logic of safe upgrade is replaced by common handler
code which's goal is to ensure we down current master only after
we have backups ready.

This change introduces a switch to kolla_docker module that allows
to ignore missing containers (as they are logically stopped).
ignore_missing is the switch's name.
All tests are included.

Change-Id: I22ddec5f7ee4a7d3d502649a158a7e005fe29c48

commit_message:
Add IPv6 route information to worlddump

The "ip route" command only outputs IPv4 routes, add a command to also
show IPv6 route information.

Drop output from "ip link" as that information is contained within the
"ip addr" output already.

Change-Id: Iae87f43c4b1c57f07de041e823da9d350c670389

subject: Move ansible-runner to 1.4.0 to fix unclosed fd in 1.3.4
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-15 08:20:58.000000000', 'message': 'Move ansible-runner to 1.4.0 to fix unclosed fd in 1.3.4

In ansible-runner 1.3.4 process isolation cleanup was failing
because some file descriptor for the stdout in the runner
was not closed.
The close fd function was a noop (pass), so a fix has been
merged and pushed in 1.4.0 in order to cleanly flush and
close the fd.

This commit ask to bump to this version in order to get
a clean release of ansible-runner in stable/train.

Change-Id: I192f8ce533c2668facae0ed44834097282ef3be2
'}]
commit_message:
Move ansible-runner to 1.4.0 to fix unclosed fd in 1.3.4

In ansible-runner 1.3.4 process isolation cleanup was failing
because some file descriptor for the stdout in the runner
was not closed.
The close fd function was a noop (pass), so a fix has been
merged and pushed in 1.4.0 in order to cleanly flush and
close the fd.

This commit ask to bump to this version in order to get
a clean release of ansible-runner in stable/train.

Change-Id: I192f8ce533c2668facae0ed44834097282ef3be2

commit_message:
Pin designate-tempest-plugin to 0.7.0 for train branch

Py2.7 based installs on CentOS 7 are failing in CI due to this
plugin having removed py2.7 compatibility in the 0.8.0 release.

Change-Id: Ic7c2c54f77f3791f1458dae4696275427d5c79db

subject: Allow 'rp_filter' to be configured by individual deployments
messages: [{'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2020-09-11 12:37:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2020-09-11 15:49:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-09-11 19:12:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-10-16 13:26:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-11 12:37:31.000000000', 'message': "Allow 'rp_filter' to be configured by individual deployments

The value of '0' for rp_filter appears to be unnecessary in at
least some deployments, and can lead to confusing symptoms where
apparently impossible network routes are available. It may also
pose a security risk for hosts which are closer to the Internet.

Changing this default could be very disruptive to deployments
which depend upon it, but for those that wish to change it this
currently requires re-definition of the entire
'openstack_kernel_options' dict.

This patch adds two new variables to enable user-configuration of
the 'net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter' and
'net.ipv4.conf.default.rp_filter' parameters.

Change-Id: I75093e50a2786956e3669f89027042cc74b62d22
"}]
commit_message:
Allow 'rp_filter' to be configured by individual deployments

The value of '0' for rp_filter appears to be unnecessary in at
least some deployments, and can lead to confusing symptoms where
apparently impossible network routes are available. It may also
pose a security risk for hosts which are closer to the Internet.

Changing this default could be very disruptive to deployments
which depend upon it, but for those that wish to change it this
currently requires re-definition of the entire
'openstack_kernel_options' dict.

This patch adds two new variables to enable user-configuration of
the 'net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter' and
'net.ipv4.conf.default.rp_filter' parameters.

Change-Id: I75093e50a2786956e3669f89027042cc74b62d22

[{'created': '2020-10-14 10:29:45.000000000', 'message': 'Performance: skip LVM configuration if no groups configured

Currently we import the manage-lvm role with a condition that skips
tasks when no LVM groups are configured. At large scale this is
inefficient.

This change improves the performance for hosts where there are no LVM

commit_message:
Performance: skip LVM configuration if no groups configured

Currently we import the manage-lvm role with a condition that skips
tasks when no LVM groups are configured. At large scale this is
inefficient.

This change improves the performance for hosts where there are no LVM
groups configured, by using include_role rather than a static import.

Story: 2007993
Task: 40664

Change-Id: Ib51ac445cc787d7045d72a9ecec14434d432d9e7
(cherry picked from commit 5ff5e6b10011875d1c29d16a8b39498adc0145e0)

subject: CI: Fix kayobe-tox-molecule job
messages: [{'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2020-10-16 10:44:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2020-10-16 12:16:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Review-Priority+2'}, {'account_id': 30438, 'date': '2020-10-16 12:25:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2020-10-16 12:27:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-16 10:44:10.000000000', 'message': "CI: Fix kayobe-tox-molecule job

When molecule runs, it installs ansible>2.8, which is now version
2.10.1. This now also installs the ansible-base package, currently at
version 2.10.2. Then it installs the version of ansible required by
kayobe, i.e. ansible>=2.5.0,<2.8.0 (currently 2.7.18).

We end up with a tox molecule venv containing:

ansible==2.7.18
ansible-base==2.10.2

This causes the following issue (hidden by default because of no_log):

AttributeError: 'ActionModule' object has no attribute 'get_shell_option'

This commit adds requirements.txt to the molecule tox deps, which
ensures the correct version of ansible gets installed first.

Change-Id: I7ef890a2ae6fd67f53e1b8bca244a1c0d44fea53
(cherry picked from commit c58555498836066002dc33620018e9bd1e2eeb6a)
"}]
commit_message:
CI: Fix kayobe-tox-molecule job

When molecule runs, it installs ansible>2.8, which is now version
2.10.1. This now also installs the ansible-base package, currently at
version 2.10.2. Then it installs the version of ansible required by
kayobe, i.e. ansible>=2.5.0,<2.8.0 (currently 2.7.18).

We end up with a tox molecule venv containing:

ansible==2.7.18
ansible-base==2.10.2

This causes the following issue (hidden by default because of no_log):

AttributeError: 'ActionModule' object has no attribute 'get_shell_option'

This commit adds requirements.txt to the molecule tox deps, which
ensures the correct version of ansible gets installed first.

Change-Id: I7ef890a2ae6fd67f53e1b8bca244a1c0d44fea53
(cherry picked from commit c58555498836066002dc33620018e9bd1e2eeb6a)

[{'created': '2020-10-03 06:34:09.000000000', 'message': "optimize size and time using --no-cache-dir

Using --no-cache-dir flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

commit_message:
optimize size and time using --no-cache-dir

Using --no-cache-dir flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: If23d9d3cf1daf4496cef87c2c4241502287901ba
Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>

commit_message:
optimize size and time using --no-cache-dir

Using --no-cache-dir flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: I4370e1abb1ee2a5a97870a7cc8611f432cb15cce
Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

commit_message:
Increase available cores and memory for octavia unit

The charm Octavia gate job has started to OOM for the Octavia
units as detailed on the bug.

This change addresses both that issue and attempts to increase the
velocity of the test by adding CPU cores which might help for the
time it takes to compile binary dependencies on initial deploy
and during the policyd tests.

Note that instead of explicitly mentioning amount of memory we
assume a flavor with more cores to also have more memory.

Func-Test-Pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/418
Change-Id: I0f332c5f6d97ed99f59c9985ff4a033920708bf2
Closes-Bug: #1895319
(cherry picked from commit 6e5f83571ca6b63af734990c978a2284fb70e8a4)

Change-Id: I78a7592562a6249629f4d236ca59eb83d9094123
Closes-Bug: #1898465
"}]
commit_message:
Added validation for csrf_failure GET argument

During csrf_failure argument validation horizon drops unknown messages
so nobody can't inject any message to login view.

Change-Id: I78a7592562a6249629f4d236ca59eb83d9094123
Closes-Bug: #1898465

commit_message:
Pass in correct port id parameter

When calling interface create on a server, the port id must be passed in
port_id as specified in [1].  Passing in the incorrect parameter was
causing nodes to go into error state during cluster update that involved
a profile whose network was changed.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=create-interface-detail#create-interface

Change-Id: I4627cba1064097234c765a7c97cfd1be8b3224a7
Closes-Bug: #1895759
(cherry picked from commit aca5b42d81bf3ec422ea6452027f3527c3b5443b)

commit_message:
Remove some py38 job cruft

For a time, we wanted to flag it as being voting while it still wasn't
voting for most of OpenStack. It's not needed now, though.

Change-Id: Idccb731a0814335fc4d314eed5caa1f336212b22

subject: baremetal: Install iptables for Docker if enabled
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-10-14 10:18:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-10-15 13:42:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2020-10-16 07:17:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-14 10:18:18.000000000', 'message': 'baremetal: Install iptables for Docker if enabled

If iptables is not installed, e.g. in the CentOS 8 cloud image, and
Docker iptables management is enabled, we get the following errors:

Failed to find iptables: exec: \"iptables\": executable file not found
in $PATH failed to start daemon: Error initializing network controller:
error obtaining controller instance: failed to create NAT chain DOCKER:
Iptables not found

This change installs the iptables package Docker iptables management is
enabled.

Change-Id: I3ba5318debccafb28c3cbce8e4e9813c28b086fc
Closes-Bug: #1899060
(cherry picked from commit bc1d02d89681b92f379b3e356d7778aa6044f297)
'}]
commit_message:
baremetal: Install iptables for Docker if enabled

If iptables is not installed, e.g. in the CentOS 8 cloud image, and
Docker iptables management is enabled, we get the following errors:

Failed to find iptables: exec: \"iptables\": executable file not found
in $PATH failed to start daemon: Error initializing network controller:
error obtaining controller instance: failed to create NAT chain DOCKER:
Iptables not found

This change installs the iptables package Docker iptables management is
enabled.

Change-Id: I3ba5318debccafb28c3cbce8e4e9813c28b086fc
Closes-Bug: #1899060
(cherry picked from commit bc1d02d89681b92f379b3e356d7778aa6044f297)

commit_message:
Rename horizon_* ssl params to ssl_*

This renames the horizon_* ssl parameters to
be named ssl_*. It also adds an enforcement to
the end users to set ssl_verify_client if
the ssl_ca (or deprecated horizon_ca) is used
since it wont take effect.

See the puppetlabs-apache 2.1.0 release notes [1].

[1]
https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-apache/blob/2.1.0/CHANGELOG.md#changed

Change-Id: I4d3b8623924ad646bf4880ad70fb3ce9be1675c2

commit_message:
Allow user to override UseDNS in template

You could perhaps have something that overrides a container network
like this;

---
container_extra_networks:
  dns_address:
    ...
    dhcp_use_dns: false

and would take precedence over lxc_container_enable_resolved

Also documentations says UseDNS takes true/false

https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.network.html#UseDNS=

Change-Id: I91f25eaf0782a6b4febfc95d9ee7c33f1f965224

commit_message:
Allow user to override UseRoutes in template

You could perhaps have a group_vars/designate_all.yml looking like
this;

---
lxc_container_networks:
  lxcbr0_address:
    ...
    dhcp_use_routes: false

Change-Id: Id61fdb5a3b52a01a49242fc01cc01bf2dede09af

commit_message:
[ussuri] Migrate to content provider jobs/templates

This change migrate c8 jobs/templates to content provider
jos so consumer jobs can use resources built by provider
jobs.

Change-Id: I83f6056cc64aafde6244ef47b02bb923fad48140
Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-28 09:32:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix instantiation of manager.AgentManager on cmd.polling.create_polling_service

The commit 28f0a70da99b2fde2479ce6a5c62128ab75554af broke the selection of polling
 namespaces. When creating the agent manager we should define the polling group
 that we want to use. Otherwise, Ceilometer will for instance enable the "central"
 polling methods in the compute nodes, and vice versa.

Change-Id: I179c95a7bfaf5d9722037618108fc882d85fda5a
Signed-off-by: Rafael Weingärtner <rafael@apache.org>
(cherry picked from commit 6ba6726aee103b8474ba79d31880e2af77167f0f)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix instantiation of manager.AgentManager on cmd.polling.create_polling_service

The commit 28f0a70da99b2fde2479ce6a5c62128ab75554af broke the selection of polling
 namespaces. When creating the agent manager we should define the polling group
 that we want to use. Otherwise, Ceilometer will for instance enable the "central"
 polling methods in the compute nodes, and vice versa.

Change-Id: I179c95a7bfaf5d9722037618108fc882d85fda5a
Signed-off-by: Rafael Weingärtner <rafael@apache.org>
(cherry picked from commit 6ba6726aee103b8474ba79d31880e2af77167f0f)

commit_message:
Add logic for event_update handling and set transfer event as event_update

This patch implements logic for updating resources in gnocchi when an
event_update happens. Additionally, it adds volume.transfer events to
the event_definitions.yaml and attributes for said event in
gnocchi_resources.yaml

Change-Id: I15bc4e1589f92fc856876a563122c1a1e07d4c4a
(cherry picked from commit aa6b4e86421312665155485e0018643939f48572)

commit_message:
Rehome api tests for propagate_uplink_status

Since [0] was merged propagate_uplink_status value is True,
tempest (and neutron-tempest-plugin) is branchless, so
test_create_port_without_propagate_uplink_status and
test_create_port_with_propagate_uplink_status can be moved to
fullstack tests to keep the coverage.

commit_message:
Pass in correct port id parameter

When calling interface create on a server, the port id must be passed in
port_id as specified in [1].  Passing in the incorrect parameter was
causing nodes to go into error state during cluster update that involved
a profile whose network was changed.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=create-interface-detail#create-interface

Change-Id: I4627cba1064097234c765a7c97cfd1be8b3224a7
Closes-Bug: #1895759
(cherry picked from commit aca5b42d81bf3ec422ea6452027f3527c3b5443b)

commit_message:
Reuse the docs deps to benefit from constraints

Tox trying to install latest versions for building releasenotes,
which may not be supported by stable and lower branches,
so should be restricted by respective version's upper-constraints.txt
This ps to reuse upper-constraints.txt from docs deps

Change-Id: I70d53f31dccca644bcea1abf0b1976bc7121ffe9

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-13 14:06:42.000000000', 'message': 'Allow tap interface with multiqueue

When vif_type="tap" (such as when using calico),
attempting to create an instance using an image that has
the property hw_vif_multiqueue_enabled=True fails, because
the interface is always being created without multiqueue
flags.

This change checks if the property is defined and passes
the multiqueue parameter to create the tap interface
accordingly.

In case the multiqueue parameter is passed but the
vif_model is not virtio (or unspecified), the old
behavior is maintained.

Change-Id: I0307c43dcd0cace1620d2ac75925651d4ee2e96c
Closes-bug: #1893263
(cherry picked from commit 84cfc8e9ab1396ec17abcfc9646c7d40f1d966ae)
(cherry picked from commit a69845f3732843ee1451b2e4ebf547d9801e898d)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow tap interface with multiqueue

When vif_type="tap" (such as when using calico),
attempting to create an instance using an image that has
the property hw_vif_multiqueue_enabled=True fails, because
the interface is always being created without multiqueue
flags.

This change checks if the property is defined and passes
the multiqueue parameter to create the tap interface
accordingly.

In case the multiqueue parameter is passed but the
vif_model is not virtio (or unspecified), the old
behavior is maintained.

Change-Id: I0307c43dcd0cace1620d2ac75925651d4ee2e96c
Closes-bug: #1893263
(cherry picked from commit 84cfc8e9ab1396ec17abcfc9646c7d40f1d966ae)
(cherry picked from commit a69845f3732843ee1451b2e4ebf547d9801e898d)

commit_message:
Fix CA file for API client

If a custom CA file is configured via OPENSTACK_SSL_CACERT, currently
communication with Keystone will fail, since the session is not created
using this CA file.

This change fixes the issue by passing the path to the CA file to the
keystoneauth session constructor.

Change-Id: Iad1bdea97ed649cc3c8f042dc5dd147b989dfd0e
Closes-Bug: #1873736
(cherry picked from commit 59ee1d59a1e08cd2245a8e876ea8931419ac5e32)

commit_message:
Automatically set tag's based on role names

To keep backward compatibility automatically set tags
for role based on the role name.

Log's a deprecation warning when automatically adding a
tag to give user's heads up to add the tags to their
role file.

Change-Id: I6f44856a5149a623d963f3f26e189bcbb418703a

subject: CI: Turn on cleaning on standalone jobs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 15519, 'name': 'Iury Gregory Melo Ferreira', 'display_name': 'Iury Gregory', 'email': 'iurygregory@gmail.com', 'username': 'iurygregory'}, {'_account_id': 19003, 'name': 'Fujitsu iRMC CI', 'email': 'fj-lsoft-irmcci@dl.jp.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'Fujitsu_iRMC_CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-10-09 15:27:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-10-11 21:27:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-10-15 22:58:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This is unfortunately not the right fix. :('}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-09 15:27:55.000000000', 'message': "CI: Turn on cleaning on standalone jobs

We have the VM count, we have a low concurrency, we _should_
be able to run cleaning. Without cleaning, we will possibly
reuse raid sets as default root devices, which is bad^(tm).

The result can be that cirros is written to /dev/md0, and
then never actually boots.

This can be observed with the Standalone jobs with the
rescue job where we don't try to login post-deployment
where we don't actually try to login before testing rescue
so the VM may never actually be working, which is why
this is so well hidden with a race condition.

Change-Id: Ie075ebadc938cf8913b859ffacb012b5da83612f
"}]
commit_message:
CI: Turn on cleaning on standalone jobs

We have the VM count, we have a low concurrency, we _should_
be able to run cleaning. Without cleaning, we will possibly
reuse raid sets as default root devices, which is bad^(tm).

The result can be that cirros is written to /dev/md0, and
then never actually boots.

This can be observed with the Standalone jobs with the
rescue job where we don't try to login post-deployment
where we don't actually try to login before testing rescue
so the VM may never actually be working, which is why
this is so well hidden with a race condition.

Change-Id: Ie075ebadc938cf8913b859ffacb012b5da83612f

subject: Close connections created when calling module-level functions
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-04-19 05:46:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-04-20 02:08:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-04-20 14:59:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-06-17 20:43:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

this is really two changes

1) make __del__ only happen on py3 (which is what seems to have the desired effect in py3 but introduced the regression in py2)
2) make close explicit

It's not obvious to me that we couldn't just make *one* of these changes.  I don't find the __del__ particularly desirable, and the commit makes it sound like the explicit close isn't entirely sufficient

If we *could* add a request.session.close to a wrapped iterator close that's returned by get_object maybe we could drop the __del__ on both py2 AND py3!

If we ultimately need both for belts and braces, I'd guess I'd suggest we split up the changes; but for now maybe it'd make the most sense to just revert the regression for py2 and re-evaluate what's next."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-06-17 23:14:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-06-18 03:00:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-06-18 14:58:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

during the review of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/674320/ suggested that closing the connection/session every request would have a performance hit:

You don't want to close the connection every request because you'll take a perf hit for more complex usage

And that makes sense to me, maybe modern OSes can optimize it some with idle sockets or something... is this necessary?"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-03 00:37:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> You don't want to close the connection every request because you'll take a perf hit for more complex usage

I'm not buying it, at least with the way we currently handle requests Sessions. Every new HTTPConnection makes a new requests.Session, and has for years: https://github.com/openstack/python-swiftclient/blame/3.10.0/swiftclient/client.py#L409 -- so I don't expect they'd share any pools between them.

If you're really concerned about performance and *correctly* using connection pools, you use one of our Connection classes, not the module-level functions."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-08 18:39:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-08 22:05:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-09-11 19:47:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

(3 comments)

I'm lukewarm here.  I like that doing the manual close when using the module level functions directly w/o any connection management is explicit and clean - but forcing an explicit close of every session/connection feels a little OCD - I think "just let the gc and os handle it" strategy has been working ok until someone goes poking at warnings with -W 

I could be convinced there's a small performance hit, but I couldn't really measure it (it's not like we get to skip the open just because we didn't close the one we lost track of).  Moreover, I expect typical use of this module *should* be to use the Client class - not the module level functions - so maybe if you're doing it quick and dirty we care enough to keep it tidy, but not enough to try and re-use a global connection and get in trouble with thread-safety.

My *real* problem with this change is probably just having to see it update every methods `if http_conn` boilerplate and then extending the mess to the bottom of every method - it's just begging for a context manager!

But that mess is mostly pre-existing; so I guess my only reservation left is that this change would be A LOT better with some updates to the test fake_http_connection infra that let us make assertions about the closed/open status of the returned or passed in conn:

    https://review.opendev.org/751418'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-11 22:07:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

Speaking of ugly boilerplate... I would *love* to do a major overhaul to swiftclient -- reduce the duplication by routing everything through some central make_request function (not unlike what requests does), make sure all functions can take some common set of args (query_string *still* isn't plumbed everywhere), get rid of the stupid httplib->requests shim, use keystoneauth1, ..."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-11 22:09:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-21 18:31:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-22 16:29:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-10-13 17:20:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

This is ok, if it make someone less unhappy - let's just merge it"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-10-13 17:45:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-10-14 00:42:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-10-15 17:04:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-19 05:46:53.000000000', 'message': 'Only add __del__ to HTTPConnection shim on py3

Apparently, on py2, this causes the connection to *not* get cleaned up
during normal GC (??).

Additionally, when safe, close the connection inline with whatever
function call created it. The lone hold-out is get_object, which may
need the connection to be open until the iterators is drained or closed.

Change-Id: Id62e63afc6f2ffa32eb8640787c78559481050f9
Related-Change: I200ad0cdc8b7999c3f5521b9a822122bd18714bf
Closes-Bug: #1873435

commit_message:
Filter supported extension for OVN mech driver

OVN mechanism driver has support for  a defined set of ML2 API
extensions. When the ML2Plugin is loaded, the OVN mechanism driver
will return, from the loaded plugin extensions, only the supported
subset.

Change-Id: Id23aa1c107504d47b08007752159b07f089c3090
Related-Bug: #1888829

commit_message:
Remove Babel requirement

Remove babel.cfg and the translation bits from setup.cfg, those are not
needed anymore.

Change-Id: Ia70ca75cde26c41aab142ca7a8fff977aedc0f42
